fields.description:
Due to the following issues we've had with gevent, let's switch to eventlet for the console's concurrency needs
- We require a monkey-patched version for CentOS/RHEL 6 support (see GUI-1339)
- There are SSL issues with gevent on Python 2.7, see https://github.com/gevent/gevent/issues/702

[~mbacchi] has lined up a change to replace gevent with eventlet in the console's RPM spec (see https://github.com/mbacchi/eucaconsole-rpmspec/commit/d772760f8c1e5567), and results are promising on the package side.

This ticket will implement the necessary changes on the console side to complement https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec/pull/12

Side note: OpenStack leverages eventlet for its concurrency needs -- see http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/threading.html
fields.summary: Switch console's concurrency library from gevent to eventlet

comments.body: Completed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1833
PR 1833 merged

[~mbacchi]: Could you confirm if you're observing the SSL Certificate error noted in my earlier comment on a CentOS/RHEL environ running Python 2.7?  And could you note what Python version (e.g. 2.7.9) is on those environs?

I've been unable to implement a workaround since our code that opts out of PEP 476 when the ssl validation setting is False seems to be invoked too late since that code is run when generating the Pyramid config object in config.py, which doesn't seem to apply to the configured worker class (e.g. eventlet).  I'm open to suggestions here.

The monkey patch for SSL validation doesn't work for gunicorn, no matter which worker type, because it only gets applied to the main process, not to the workers.
I was able to add code to the gevent/monkey.py file in "patch_all" to apply the ssl validation patch and was able to use gevent on my mac.
Patching eventlet/patcher.py, allows me to use eventlet as well.

There are better solutions.
1) use the code here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27835619/ssl-certificate-verify-failed-error
{code}
import ssl

# This restores the same behavior as before.
context = ssl._create_unverified_context()
urllib.urlopen("https://no-valid-cert", context=context)
{code}
2) always require cert validation, which is more secure, but requires much better documentation to avoid user frustration

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1849

This solution uses the recommended opt-out method in the PEP
http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0476/

[~dkavanagh]: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1849 looks good, but I'm wondering if we should clean up auth.ConnectionManager to remove the caching indirection (i.e. remove the _euca_connection and _aws_connection indirections) , as we're unlikely to cache connection objects due to GUI-908?
I've thought about cleaning that up a few times. Perhaps now is as good a time as any.
Punting back to clean up auth.ConnectionManager

[~dkavanagh]: I'm still observing the SSL cert validation notice on this branch.

Here's the server:main section from my console.ini...

{code}
[server:main]
use = egg:gunicorn#main
host = 0.0.0.0
port = 8888
workers = 4
worker_class = eventlet
{code}

I have nginx running, configured with self-signed certs.  What am I missing?
[~kgill], remember, this is about validating the back end cert the cloud uses.
[~dkavanagh]: I know, but I have connection.ssl.validation = false and I'm still observing the SSL cert validation issue and can't log in to our latest dev cloud.  Please advise.

I just verified. I ran with eventlet and 4 workers, like you, and using master, I see the SSL error.
I switched to the GUI-2473 branch and can then login normally. Are you sure you don't have workers running from another invocation? I find reload doesn't work quite as well.
[~dkavanagh]: No luck here with that config on the GUI-2473 branch.  Could you email me your console.ini file for comparison purposes?
[~dkavanagh]: I compared my local GUI-2473 copy with what's in PR 1833 and saw a few discrepancies, so I wiped out my local branch and re-pulled from GitHub.  Seems better now... sorry for the noise.
[~dkavanagh]: Testing on Euca and AWS, with connection.ssl.validation = false and connection.ssl.validation = true, this works as expected.  Nice work!
PR 1849 merged

[~dkavanagh]: Just a heads up PR 1849 didn't guard against the missing ssl._create_unverified_context() method, which isn't there in Python 2.6 or 2.7 < 2.7.9.  Opened GUI-2497 as a follow-up, fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1859  The prior fix had the guard in a try/except clause, which was removed in PR 1849.  Sorry I didn't catch that in the code review.

Verified the worker_class is set to eventlet in the console.ini (although I think this will be changed to not be configurable by the user in the console.ini in the future if it already hasn't been done.)
